entities.name: BOARD OF DIRECTORS
entities.description: The governing body responsible for overseeing the activities of the corporation. They have the authority to fill vacancies and create new directorships.

entities.name: CALIFORNIA CORPORATIONS CODE
entities.description: A set of laws governing corporate entities in California.

entities.name: CORPORATION
entities.description: A legal entity that is separate and distinct from its owners. The text refers to a specific corporation with a Board of Directors and stockholders.

entities.name: STOCKHOLDERS
entities.description: Individuals or entities that own shares in the corporation. They have rights to vote in elections of directors and on other corporate matters.

relationships.relationship_description: The Board of Directors oversees the activities of the Corporation and has the authority to fill vacancies and create new directorships.
The Corporation is subject to the regulations and provisions of the California Corporations Code.
Stockholders own shares in the Corporation and have voting rights in the election of directors and other corporate matters.
Stockholders have the right to vote in the election of the Board of Directors.
